intro: Calycophyllum tefense, commonly known as the African starwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Calycophyllum tefense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
